CHAT.comment: Chi's first name is same as that of Eric Carle , and they talk and write about it.

Chi rereads the entire book before he begins to write. Mot gives Chi the first sentence , but the rest is all Chi's work. Mot prompts Chi occasionally about the proper form for letters , and Chi responds correctly. Mot by and large does not correct Chi's work (such as spelling too with one o). Chi asks Mot for a few spellings , which Mot provides. For the most part , Chi writes silently. Chi asks a few times if some of his ideas for what to write are okay , to which Mot replies very supportively. Interaction between Mot and Chi is very quiet , very supportive , very gentle. Chi writes in cursive , has a little trouble reading his own writing.

u.a: movement of tape player makes this utterance difficult to hear
EXP fiddles with the tape recorder for about 0:20
Chi reads the book silently to himself . Mot and EXP discuss whether or not to find an extension cord so that tape recorder can be placed closer to Chi
aft sound of Chi putting his pen down can be heard
perhaps referring to p in caterpillar
on paper there are many stray marks in writing of through
discuss cat , then silence again as Chi writes , then Mot and EXP have a very soft discussion of the weather
EXP speaks a little under her breath as she adjusts the tape recorder; Chi writes in silence
